name: disamis
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: mpbi(wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)), wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w1))

body.origin: |- wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w1))

comment: "Disamis", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. Some ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and all ` ph ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is ` ps ` . In Aristotelian notation, IAI-3: MiP and MaS therefore SiP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
